intro: Stenosemis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stenosemis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in spikes, often with a striking coloration. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
